channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Airbus calls for 'immediate' software upgrade to A320 aircraft
item.description: A320 planes are flown by a number of domestic and international airlines, and the required software update could lead to "operational disruptions to passengers and customers," according to Airbus.
item.content:encoded:
A320 planes are flown by a number of domestic and international airlines, and the required software update could lead to "operational disruptions to passengers and customers," according to Airbus.

(Image credit: Daniel Slim)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Ventre

item.title: Trump administration pausing all asylum decisions after National Guard shooting
item.description: After the alleged shooter was identified as Rahmanullah Lakanwal — a 29-year-old Afghan national — Trump said he would permanently shut down immigration from impoverished countries.
item.content:encoded:
After the alleged shooter was identified as Rahmanullah Lakanwal — a 29-year-old Afghan national — Trump said he would permanently shut down immigration from impoverished countries.

(Image credit: Roberto Schmidt)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Nebraska's newest public official is 10-years-old
item.description: The Kid Governor program is a nationwide initiative that helps teach kids about government by holding elections. Nebraska just elected 10-year-old Charlie Couch as it's first kid governor.
item.content:encoded: The Kid Governor program is a nationwide initiative that helps teach kids about government by holding elections. Nebraska just elected 10-year-old Charlie Couch as it's first kid governor.
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger

item.title: States sue the Trump administration over major homelessness spending cuts
item.description: States are suing the Trump administration over its plan to massively cut back long-term housing for homeless people. Advocates say the changes could push more than 100,000 residents onto the streets.
item.content:encoded: States are suing the Trump administration over its plan to massively cut back long-term housing for homeless people. Advocates say the changes could push more than 100,000 residents onto the streets.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: Trump administration zeroes in on immigration as shooting investigation continues
item.description: The investigation continues into the shooting of National Guard members in the nation's capital as the Trump administration turns blame more broadly to immigrants in the U.S.
item.content:encoded: The investigation continues into the shooting of National Guard members in the nation's capital as the Trump administration turns blame more broadly to immigrants in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Romo

item.title: National Guard member dies from injuries. And, death toll in Hong Kong fire rises
item.description: National Guard member Sarah Beckstrom had died from her injuries after a shooting in the nation's capital. And, the death toll in the Hong Kong high-rise fire rises as dozens remain missing.
item.content:encoded:
National Guard member Sarah Beckstrom had died from her injuries after a shooting in the nation's capital. And, the death toll in the Hong Kong high-rise fire rises as dozens remain missing.

(Image credit: Andrew Leyden)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: National Guard member dies from injuries after D.C. shooting
item.description: Sarah Beckstrom, one of the two West Virginia National Guard members shot Wednesday in Washington, D.C., died Thursday. The latest on the investigation into the attack.
item.content:encoded: Sarah Beckstrom, one of the two West Virginia National Guard members shot Wednesday in Washington, D.C., died Thursday. The latest on the investigation into the attack.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: 'It's heartbreaking': West Virginia community reacts to National Guard shooting
item.description: National Guardsman Andrew Wolfe remains in critical condition after he and another member of the West Virginia National Guard were shot in Washington D.C. Wolfe is from Martinsburg, West Virginia and went there to see how the community is responding to the news.
item.content:encoded: National Guardsman Andrew Wolfe remains in critical condition after he and another member of the West Virginia National Guard were shot in Washington D.C. Wolfe is from Martinsburg, West Virginia and went there to see how the community is responding to the news.
item.dc:creator: Dave Mistich

item.title: Army National Guard vet talks about the attack on two National Guard members in D.C.
item.description: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Army National Guard veteran Christopher Purdy about the implications for Afghan refugees following the shooting of two National Guard members in Washington, D.C.
item.content:encoded: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Army National Guard veteran Christopher Purdy about the implications for Afghan refugees following the shooting of two National Guard members in Washington, D.C.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: The DOT says it wants to make trucking safer, but some see an 'immigration raid'
item.description: The Department of Transportation wants tougher rules for commercial driver's licenses after a deadly crash involving a trucker from India. Critics say it's an immigration crackdown by another name.
item.content:encoded:
The Department of Transportation wants tougher rules for commercial driver's licenses after a deadly crash involving a trucker from India. Critics say it's an immigration crackdown by another name.

(Image credit: Cody Jackson)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose
